ygData.subject: Re: BATTLE at the Ark!
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson could hear Talon with his spark, and puts a hand over his chest.  He knew she was suffering.  As he had done for Vestage, he now concentrates his own

Tucson could hear Talon with his spark, and puts a hand over his chest.  He=
 knew she was suffering.  As he had done for Vestage, he now concentrates h=
is own internal systems to try and help Talon as well.  He sends a message =
to her from within his own cabin.

" I will, I promise.  I've been forwarne=
d about Ninjabots from my former Sensai, Master Yokitron.  Each is differen=
t, and each is more unpredictable than the next.  Therefore, we must always=
 be aware of unpredictability.  I fear for Rodimus though, he has met this =
ninjabot before, and I sense this is how he had been captured the first tim=
e.  And now, Nightrazor may be attempting it again.  I have to break his de=
fense.  Using my sonar is out, he's disrupted my sonar systems.  He knows m=
e..  And I know him."

Straight Shot stays still for a moment, and then, sh=
e realizes something she hadn't before.  She still had her thermal detectio=
n systems in check.  She puts out a hand, and senses the temperature variat=
ions which translate into Nightrazor's pressense.  She raises a brow and st=
arts tapping on Tucson's leg.

" Yess!  He may have knocked out our audio a=
nd video but he hasn't knocked out thermal sensing equipment.  Tucson, you =
have that ability too, since you're visually impaired."

Tucson puts his ha=
nd out.  He could feel it.  

"Yes, I do.  Good work Straight Shot.  All ri=
ght, transform into weapon mode and mount on my arm.  It's time to make tha=
t little shot in the dark come true."

Straight Shot nodds, and with therma=
l sensing, she transforms and leaps up onto Tucson's good arm.  It's at thi=
s time where both bots combine their senses, as skilled target masters. 

O=
nce together, they concentrate on pinpointing an appropriate target area to=
 disable Nightrazor and prevent him from escaping the Ark as he would hope =
to do.  Straight Shot's thoughts were to strike in an area which would defi=
nitely stop Nightrazor.  She probes with her thermal sensing equipment, hop=
ing to find a spot in his spinal servos.
Tucson concentrates as well, reali=
zing that perhaps a spinal shot would be best.  He narrows an optic, and al=
so senses a spot as well.  He concentrates on an area where there appears t=
o be an opening and meets Straight Shot's intentions perfectly.

"Right.  I=
t won't kill him, but it will disable him. Let's hope this works. Thermal s=
ensing equipment is online, scanning target, confirming target location.  T=
arget locked.  Cross your fingers Talon, and let's hope this works."

He pu=
lls the trigger, and on thermal sensory systems only, he attempts a tricky =
shot to Nightrazor's spinal servos.

e feels through his

> Rodimus too, would be able to sense touch, and vibr=
ation.  He could feel

prehend him sufficiantly."

ld get a faint idea as to

  A cross breeze as stale as

ncy generator switch.  He follows

to touch it, slowly comming to the

ow he carefully throws the switch and

cat if he didn't move his aft out of the way of Cyclonus's fire.  In mid 
>=
 air, he's forced to duck the blast, which causes him to lose concentration=

s his

nd me not - ta try that again."

ing foe.

t mode.

ld go wrong.

ack Fortress."

istance if you are."

ame, those sweeps will get us for sure."

p on

 Rat Trap sniffs the air.

it, well, the burnt remains 
> anyway, kinda faint, but it's there, all I g=
otta do is follow the smell.
>

>

no signal.  Yeah we'll have ta go that route little guy."
> 
> Slowly Rat T=
rap follows the scent, but is careful as to where he steps. 
> Night Shift =
realizes that he's ten times heavier than Rat Trap, and 
> carefully tests =
each step as he goes along.
> 
> Along the way, he notices some botanical l=
ife that he had never seen before. 
> He notices a large moth like insect d=
rinking the nectar from the mysterious 
> plant.
> 
> " This place might be=
 strange, but at least it supports life."
> 
> He then walks along, leaving=
 the plant and insect alone.
